text: ਰਾਗੁ ਸੋਰਠਿ ਬਾਣੀ ਭਗਤ ਕਬੀਰ ਜੀ ਕੀ ਘਰੁ ੧
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Raag Sorat'h, The Word Of Devotee Kabeer Jee, First House:

transliteration.text: rāg sōrath bānī bhagat kabīr jī kī ghar 1

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਬੁਤ ਪੂਜਿ ਪੂਜਿ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਮੂਏ ਤੁਰਕ ਮੂਏ ਸਿਰੁ ਨਾਈ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Worshipping their idols, the Hindus die; the Muslims die bowing their heads.

transliteration.text: but pūj pūj hindū mūē turak mūē sir nāī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਓਇ ਲੇ ਜਾਰੇ ਓਇ ਲੇ ਗਾਡੇ ਤੇਰੀ ਗਤਿ ਦੁਹੂ ਨ ਪਾਈ ॥੧॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Hindus cremate their dead, while the Muslims bury theirs; neither finds Your true state, Lord. ||1||

transliteration.text: ōi lē jārē ōi lē gādē tērī gat duhū n pāī .1.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:

section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O mind, the world is a deep, dark pit.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਚਹੁ ਦਿਸ ਪਸਰਿਓ ਹੈ ਜਮ ਜੇਵਰਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: On all four sides, Death has spread his net. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: chah dis pasariō hai jam jēvarā .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਕਬਿਤ ਪੜੇ ਪੜਿ ਕਬਿਤਾ ਮੂਏ ਕਪੜ ਕੇਦਾਰੈ ਜਾਈ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Reciting their poems, the poets die; the mystical ascetics die while journeying to Kaydaar Naat'h.

transliteration.text: kabit parē par kabitā mūē kapar kēdārai jāī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਜਟਾ ਧਾਰਿ ਧਾਰਿ ਜੋਗੀ ਮੂਏ ਤੇਰੀ ਗਤਿ ਇਨਹਿ ਨ ਪਾਈ ॥੨॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Yogis die, with their matted hair, but even they do not find Your state, Lord. ||2||

transliteration.text: jatā dhār dhār jōgī mūē tērī gat inah n pāī .2.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਦਰਬੁ ਸੰਚਿ ਸੰਚਿ ਰਾਜੇ ਮੂਏ ਗਡਿ ਲੇ ਕੰਚਨ ਭਾਰੀ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The kings die, gathering and hoarding their money, burying great quantities of gold.

transliteration.text: darab sanch sanch rājē mūē gad lē kanchan bhārī .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਬੇਦ ਪੜੇ ਪੜਿ ਪੰਡਿਤ ਮੂਏ ਰੂਪੁ ਦੇਖਿ ਦੇਖਿ ਨਾਰੀ ॥੩॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Pandits die, reading and reciting the Vedas; women die, gazing at their own beauty. ||3||

transliteration.text: bēd parē par pandit mūē rūp dēkh dēkh nārī .3.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮ ਬਿਨੁ ਸਭੈ ਬਿਗੂਤੇ ਦੇਖਹੁ ਨਿਰਖਿ ਸਰੀਰਾ ॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Without the Lord's Name, all come to ruin; behold, and know this, O body.

transliteration.text: rām nām bin sabhai bigūtē dēkhah nirakh sarīrā .

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.

text: ਹਰਿ ਕੇ ਨਾਮ ਬਿਨੁ ਕਿਨਿ ਗਤਿ ਪਾਈ ਕਹਿ ਉਪਦੇਸੁ ਕਬੀਰਾ ॥੪॥੧॥
section: Sorath - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Without the Name of the Lord, who can find salvation? Kabeer speaks the Teachings. ||4||1||

transliteration.text: har kē nām bin kin gat pāī kah upadēs kabīrā .4.1.

melody.description: Sorath conveys the feeling of having such a strong belief in something that you want to keep repeating the experience. In fact this feeling of certainty is so strong that you become the belief and live that belief. The atmosphere of Sorath is so powerful, that eventually even the most unresponsive listener will be attracted.
